OscillatoryNetwork#

Module Contents#

Classes#

OscillatoryNetwork

This class runs the simulation of the network of neurons.
class OscillatoryNetwork.OscillatoryNetwork(stimulus, nr_excitatory, nr_inhibitory, nr_ping_networks=1)#

This class runs the simulation of the network of neurons.

Every neuron in the system can be described with a 2D system of ODEs:

\(dp_v / dt = 0.04 p_v^2 + 5 p_v + 140 - r_v + I_v\),

\(dr_v / dt = \alpha_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \cdot (\beta_{\mathsf{type}(v)} p_v - r_v)\),

if \(p_v \geq 30\) mV, then \(\begin{cases} p_v \leftarrow \gamma_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \\ r_v \leftarrow r_v + \zeta_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \end{cases}\),

where

  • \(v\) is a neuron,

  • \(\mathsf{type}(v)\) maps a neuron to its type (see NeuronTypes),

  • \(p\) represents the membrane potential of the neuron,

  • \(r\) represents a membrane recovery variable; provides negative feedback to \(p\),

  • \(\alpha\) describes the timescale of \(r\) (see constants.IZHI_ALPHA),

  • \(\beta\) describes the sensitivity of \(r\) to the subthreshold fluctuations of \(p\) (see constants.IZHI_BETA),

  • \(\gamma\) describes the after-spike reset value of \(p\) (see constants.IZHI_GAMMA),

  • \(\zeta\) describes the after-spike reset of \(r\) (see constants.IZHI_ZETA),

  • \(I\) describes the _current.

This neural dynamics model is introduced in [Izhikevich, 2003].

In the network, neurons are not isolated, and the current involves the accumulated effect of interactions with other neurons: TODO:: change the equation to match the report

\(I_v = \begin{cases} \sum_{w \in V} K_{v, w} I_{syn, w} + I_{stim, v} &\text{ if } \mathsf{type}(v) = ex \\ \sum_{w \in V} K_{v, w} I_{syn, w} &\text{ if } \mathsf{type}(v) = in \end{cases}\),

where

  • \(K\) is the coupling weights (see GridConnectivity),

  • \(I_{syn}\) represents the effect of synaptic potentials,

  • \(I_{stim}\) is the current caused by external stimuli.

Parameters

  • stimulus (TODO) – TODO

  • nr_excitatory (int) – number of excitatory neurons in the network.

  • nr_inhibitory (int) – number of inhibitory neurons in the network.

  • nr_ping_networks (int) – number of ping_networks in the network.

Raises

AssertionError: if the number of excitatory neurons is smaller than 2.

Raises

AssertionError: if the number of inhibitory neurons is smaller than 2.

Variables

  • _nr_neurons – number of neurons of each type in the network.

  • _nr_ping_networks – number of ping_networks in the network.

  • _stimulus – TODO

  • _currents – current (from input and interaction).

  • _potentials – voltage (membrane potential).

  • _recovery – membrane recovery variable.

  • _izhi_alpha – timescale of recovery variable recovery.

  • _izhi_beta – sensitivity of recovery to sub-threshold oscillations of potential.

  • _izhi_gamma – membrane voltage after spike (after-spike reset of potential).

  • _izhi_zeta – after-spike reset of recovery variable recovery.

run_simulation(self, cortical_coords: list[list[tuple[float, float]]], simulation_time: int, dt: float) → None#

Runs the simulation.

Parts of the code in this function and its components are rewritten from MATLAB code listed in supplementary materials of [Lowet et al., 2015].

Parameters

  • cortical_coords (list[list[tuple[float, float]]]) – locations of PING networks in the visual cortex.

  • simulation_time (int) – number of epochs to run the simulation.

  • dt (float) – time interval

Return type

None

_get_change_in_recovery(self) → numpy.ndarray[int, float]#

Computes the change in membrane recovery.

Computes \(dr_v / dt = \alpha_{\mathsf{type}(v)} \cdot (\beta_{\mathsf{type}(v)} p_v - r_v)\).

Returns

change in membrane recovery.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int, float]

_get_change_in_potentials(self) → numpy.ndarray[int, float]#

Computes the change in membrane potentials.

Computes \(dp_v / dt = 0.04 p_v^2 + 5 p_v + 140 - r_v + I_v\).

Returns

change in membrane potentials.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int, float]

_get_gatings(self, gatings: numpy.ndarray[int, float], dt: float) → numpy.ndarray[int, float]#

Computes the gating values for synapses of given types.

Parameters

  • gatings (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – current gating values.

  • dt (float) – time interval.

Returns

the change in synaptic values for a unit of time.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[int, float]

_get_synaptic_currents(self, gatings: numpy.ndarray[int, int, float], dt: float) → tuple[numpy.ndarray[int, float], numpy.ndarray[int, float]]#

Computes the new synaptic currents for postsynaptic neurons.

Computes the \(I_{syn}\).

Parameters

  • gatings (numpy.ndarray[int, float]) – synaptic gating values

  • dt (float) – time interval

Returns

change in synaptic gates for excitatory postsynaptic neurons.

Return type

numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]
